column47: To understand users' needs better, ...: data should always be collected because it might be needed later

column49: To understand users' needs better, ...: rich, detailed data about what users do is useful

column52: To understand users' needs better, ...: we need to measure user behaviour to decide what the software should be like
column53: 4.1 How much do you agree with the following statements regarding notifying users about experiments? Please answer according to your personal beliefs.: Users do not need to know they are involved
column54: 4.1 How much do you agree with the following statements regarding notifying users about experiments? Please answer according to your personal beliefs.: If we collect personal information, users need to be notified
column55: 4.1 How much do you agree with the following statements regarding notifying users about experiments? Please answer according to your personal beliefs.: If no laws are being broken, users do not need to be notified
column56: 4.1 How much do you agree with the following statements regarding notifying users about experiments? Please answer according to your personal beliefs.: Users can be involved in an experiment without their knowledge if we let them know afterwards
column57: 4.1 How much do you agree with the following statements regarding notifying users about experiments? Please answer according to your personal beliefs.: Users should always be notified when they are being involved in an experiment
column58: 4.1 How much do you agree with the following statements regarding notifying users about experiments? Please answer according to your personal beliefs.: It is ok not to disclose all the experiment details to users involved
column59: 4.1 How much do you agree with the following statements regarding notifying users about experiments? Please answer according to your personal beliefs.: It is ok to trick the user if the validity of experiment results depend on it
column60: 4.2 How much do you agree with the following statements about involving users in experiments? Please answer according to your personal beliefs.: I cannot trust that the results will be correct
column61: 4.2 How much do you agree with the following statements about involving users in experiments? Please answer according to your personal beliefs.: Involving users in experiments is time-consuming
column62: 4.2 How much do you agree with the following statements about involving users in experiments? Please answer according to your personal beliefs.: Our company does not have the needed technical infrastructure
column63: 4.2 How much do you agree with the following statements about involving users in experiments? Please answer according to your personal beliefs.: Users would not like to be part of software experiments
column64: 4.2 How much do you agree with the following statements about involving users in experiments? Please answer according to your personal beliefs.: Users have to be convinced of the benefit before taking part
column65: 4.2 How much do you agree with the following statements about involving users in experiments? Please answer according to your personal beliefs.: Experiments give users false expectations
column66: 4.2 How much do you agree with the following statements about involving users in experiments? Please answer according to your personal beliefs.: Experiments reveal secrets about the product strategy
column67: 5.1 How much do you agree with the following statements regarding benefits of experimentation? Please answer according to your personal beliefs.: Experiments would give me earlier feedback on how users respond to features
column68: 5.1 How much do you agree with the following statements regarding benefits of experimentation? Please answer according to your personal beliefs.: Experiments would give me an understanding of user value before releases
column69: 5.1 How much do you agree with the following statements regarding benefits of experimentation? Please answer according to your personal beliefs.: Experiments would mean that decisions are based on empirical evidence rather than opinions
column70: 5.1 How much do you agree with the following statements regarding benefits of experimentation? Please answer according to your personal beliefs.: Experiments would allow me to identify changes in user needs or market demand

column44: It's easy to get feedback from users, but harder is to figure out how big a portion this user represents and how relevant the feedback is in the big picture.
column46: Enabling a new feature for some specific partner to gain feedback before release.
column78: Directly involving customers in feature development requires you are also ready to and capable of implementing things based on their suggestions.

column44: I tried to get business case information from our local sales office for months without success. Turned out that our local office 1) were not so involved with the case as they originally painted the picture to be 2) they did not want to share the little info they had with me to protect their own financial interests which were quite limited compared to the company-wide opportunity that we might have had.

Product: Virtual Security (f.k.a. SVCE) Feature: Cluster support While developing the support for Clustered environment in the product, we get the requirements from Sale engineers, but the requirements were not very clear as the technology was quite unknown to everyone involved. The required features were not matching the problem domain described to Product Management by SE. If we were able to discuss or work closely with few real customers the situation would have been different and we would be able to provide solution fast.
column46: Surveys done recently for segmentation study etc.
For example, we have conducted UX validations on new features.
